page.title: 06CLUBS ON WHALSAY
page.content: { The Whalsay Boating and Sports Club built a clubhouse costing Â£50000 in 1981.A licenced club,it has 450 members.Anyone over 14 who lives on Whalsay or Skerries can join. Its aim is to encourage sailing,sport and entertainment.About 80 of the members take part in sailing . During the winter on many Saturday nights musicians play at the club.Some of them are Country & Western singers, some Shetland musicians. In August there is the sailing regatta and also land sports. { The Whalsay Crucible Snooker Club}was formed in 1982.It started when surplus snooker tables from Sullom Voe work camps were sold off.It now has 4 snooker & 2 pool tables and the building,at first a 2nd-hand portable unit,is now block-walled and roofed over.There are members.
